content.rendered:
Let’s dive into the details and learn how to make this mouthwatering Chicken and Croutons Caesar Salad.
Serves (3-4)
Ingredients:
For Chicken
1 boneless chicken breasts skinless
Salt and pepper to taste
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
For Salad
1 tablespoon olive oil
2 tablespoons green olives
1 large head of romaine lettuce or iceberg lettuce
1 cup croutons
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
For the Caesar dressing:
1/4 cup mayonnaise
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese
2 cloves garlic, minced.
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
1 tablespoon soya sauce
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. Remove from the skillet and let them cool for a few minutes. Slice the chicken into thin strips or cubes.
Combine the chopped romaine lettuce, olives, croutons, and grated Parmesan cheese in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, soya sauce, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, Dijon mustard, olive oil, salt, and pepper to make the Caesar salad dressing.
Pour the Caesar dressing over the lettuce mixture and toss to coat evenly.
Add the sliced chicken to the salad and gently toss to combine.
Serve the chicken and croutons Caesar salad & enjoy.
